In Christianity, Christmas is one of the most important festivals and is considered as the birthday of Jesus.
Many of the traditions surrounding the festival have been adopted worldwide by Christians and non-Christians alike.

There are certainly religious explanations for this tradition, but it could also be about a pre-Christian spring and fruit festival ritual.
